__TOC__

* A <nowiki>[[http://popey.com/blog/2010/08/08/first-ubuntu-uk-geeknic-a-success/|Geeknic]]</nowiki> was held in Hyde Park in London, about 20 people attended and a great time was had by all 
* <nowiki>[[http://issyl0.wordpress.com/2010/08/09/young-rewired-state-2010/|Isabell Long]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.freedomdreams.co.uk/blog/2010/08/08/young-rewired-state-2010/|Ben Webb]]</nowiki> participated in the <nowiki>[[http://rewiredstate.org/young|Young Rewired State]]</nowiki> programming event/competition in London and Tim Dobson was a mentor for the Manchester group. Several members of the LoCo attended the final presentations in London.
* A selection process for the Ubuntu-UK logo was run and the winning design submitted for trademark approval
* IRC meetings held on <nowiki>[[UKTeam-MeetingNotes-20100804|4th]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[UKTeam-MeetingNotes-20100819|19th]]</nowiki>
* The import from F-Spot feature for Shotwell (<nowiki>[[http://brunogirin.blogspot.com/2010/08/contributing-to-shotwell.html|full gory details]]</nowiki>) and a (very small) <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/librsvg/+bug/608026|patch]]</nowiki> to fix a crash in librsvg are now in Maverick.
* Two episodes of the podcast were released http://podcast.ubuntu-uk.org/2010/08/04/s03e13-three-wise-fools/ & http://podcast.ubuntu-uk.org/2010/08/19/s03e14-his-nose-in-the-book/ 
* Ubuntu 10.10 release parties being planned in London, one for the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/307/detail/|10/10/2010 in Farringdon]]</nowiki> and another with University College London (weekday event - 11/10/10 - TBC) targeted mainly at students.
* A book review was submitted to DZone.com for "The Official Ubuntu Book"
